newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Bristol-Myers opens Hungary research centre.
newsitem.headline: Bristol-Myers opens Hungary research centre.

text.p: U.S. pharmaceuticals company Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMS) on Thursday opened its new clinical research centre in Budapest, as part of its Pharmaceutical Research Institute (PRI), company officials announced.

The centre's most important task is to organise and coordinate clinical research in Hungarian hospitals in areas such as cardiovascular or oncology illnesses, BMS said in a statement. These illnesses are among the leading causes of death in Hungary.
The centre will also contribute to enhancing BMS's position in Hungary.
"It will support our business which is currently expanding in Hungary," Sebastian Wanless, BMS PRI central and east European managing director, told a news conference.
The centre will operate within the framework of Pharmavit Rt, its Hungarian subsidiary, whose takeover by BMS was completed earlier this year.
BMS PRI's European director, Annick Schwebig said BMS spends over $1 billion this year on research and development.
